page.title: 12FAUNA OF THE AREA
page.content: There is a varied fauna in the area.Occasional visitors to the river are deer-these more especially in the east of the area.Foxes are very common in certain areas and are regularly hunted during autumn,winter and spring.Local anglers often find trout(brown and rainbow)and salmon.There is virtually no pollution in the river.When the river is in flood the water is a beer colour because of the peat in the water.Common birds are found all around the river as well as others like herons,dippers,ring-ouzels and oystercatchers.Relative newcomers to the area include the gosander which is blamed locally for taking large numbers of fish.
